meanings.definition: The act of comparing two or more things to assess similarities and differences.
meanings.sent1: In the intercomparison of the two paintings, we noticed how one had brighter colors than the other.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use intercomparison to study how different species of birds build their nests.
meanings.sent3: During the intercomparison of the two cakes, we discovered that one was made with salt instead of sugar!
meanings.sent4: The intercomparison between the two cars revealed that one was as fast as a cheetah while the other was as slow as a turtle.
meanings.sent5: The intercomparison of the two planets showed that one had rings while the other did not.

meanings.definition: A comparison made between different items or groups to evaluate their characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The intercomparison of the two smartphones helped us decide which one had better camera quality.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often use intercomparison to understand the learning styles of their students.
meanings.sent3: In the intercomparison of the two ice cream flavors, we found out that one tasted like socks!
meanings.sent4: The intercomparison between the two buildings highlighted the stark contrast in their architectural styles.
meanings.sent5: The intercomparison of the two fabrics revealed that one was soft like a cloud while the other was rough like sandpaper.
